etymologies: mid 19th century: from German Microklin, from Greek mikros ‘small’ + klinein ‘to lean’ (because its angle of cleavage differs only slightly from 90 degrees)

definitions: a green, pink, or brown crystalline mineral consisting of potassium-rich feldspar, characteristic of granite and pegmatites.
shortDefinitions: green, pink, or brown crystalline mineral consisting of potassium-rich feldspar
